trans-unit.source: An abstract class used as the base class for the abstract <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Block"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Inline"></xref> classes.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> used to fill the background of the content area.
For a table of swatches that show the available predefined brush colors, see <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brushes>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The brush used to fill the background of the content area, or `null` to not use a background brush.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Background"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that represents the end of the content in the element.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument.ContentEnd%2A> property is often used to append content to the end of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> returned by this property always has its <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer.LogicalDirection%2A> set to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LogicalDirection?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that represents the end of the content in the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that represents the start of content in the element.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument.ContentStart%2A> property is often used to insert content to the beginning of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> returned by this property always has its <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer.LogicalDirection%2A> set to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LogicalDirection?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointerContext"></xref> that represents the start of the content in the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that represents the position just after the end of the element.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> returned by this property always has its <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer.LogicalDirection%2A> set to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LogicalDirection?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that represents the position just after the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"></xref> that represents the position just before the start of the element.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> returned by this property always has its <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer.LogicalDirection%2A> set to <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LogicalDirection?displayProperty=fullName>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextPointerContext"></xref> that represents the position just before the start of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref>.
Gets or sets the preferred top-level font family for the content of the element.
When multiple families are specified, the second and subsequent font families serve as fallback families to be used in cases where the primary font family is unavailable or not applicable.
This property specifies a preference only.

If the specified font family is not available, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument> silently falls back to the font determined by the <xref:System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontFamily%2A> value.
This dependency property also has an attached property usage.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is \<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontFamily%2A?displayProperty=fullName>="*value*".../>, where *object* is an object element (typically a flow element) contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TextBlock>, and *value* is one of the string-format values as explained in XAML Values.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.GetFontFamily%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.SetFontFamily%2A> methods.

The attached property usage is not common, because most elements that can be contained in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> support an analogous nonattached `FontFamily` property, which the content host uses for rendering.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*fontFamilyName*
A string specifying a font family name.
For example, `"Arial"` or `"Century Gothic"`.
*fontFamilyNamesList*
A string specifying multiple font family names, each separated by a comma (any whitespace following a comma is ignored).

The first font family specified serves as the primary font family; subsequent font families serve as fallback families to be used in cases where the primary font family is unavailable or not applicable.
For example, `"Arial, Century Gothic"` specifies Arial as the primary font family, with Century Gothic as the fallback font family.
*fontFamilyFolderReference*
A string specifying a folder containing the font, along with a font family name.
The folder and font family name are delimited by a # character.
The folder reference may be absolute, or relative.
For example, `"Custom Fonts\#My Custom Font"`.
*fontFamilyUriReference*
A string specifying a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] for the font, along with a font family name.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] and font family name are delimited by a # character.
For example, `"http://MyFontServer/Fonts/#My Custom Font"`.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.FontFamily"></xref> object that specifies the preferred font family, or a primary preferred font family with one or more fallback font families.
The default is the font determined by the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontFamily"></xref> value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontFamily"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the font size for the content of the element.
This dependency property also has an attached property usage.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is \<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName>="*value*".../>, where *object* is an object element (typically a flow element) contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>, and *value* is one of the string-format values as explained in XAML Values.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.GetFontSize%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.SetFontSize%2A> methods.

The attached property usage is not common, because most elements that can be contained in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> support an analogous nonattached `FontSize` property, which the content host uses for rendering.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*double*
String representation of a <xref:System.Double> value equal to or greater than 0.0 but smaller than <xref:System.Double.PositiveInfinity>.
An unqualified value is measured in device independent pixels.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
*qualifiedDouble*
A *double* value as described above, followed by one of the following unit specifiers: `px`, `in`, `cm`, `pt`.
`px` (default) is [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel#plural](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixelsharpplural-md.md)]
`in` is inches; 1in==96px
`cm` is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px
`pt` is points; 1pt==(96/72) px
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
The desired font size to use in device independent pixels, greater than 0.001 and less than or equal to 35791.
The default depends on current system settings and depends on the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontSize"></xref> value.
<xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize"></xref> is set to a value greater than 35791 or less than or equal to 0.001.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the font-stretching characteristics for the content of the element.
This dependency property also has an attached property usage.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is \<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStretch%2A?displayProperty=fullName>="*value*".../>, where *object* is an object element (typically a flow element) contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>, and *value* is one of the string-format property names of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStretch> class.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.GetFontStretch%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.SetFontStretch%2A> methods.

The attached property usage is not common, because most elements that can be contained in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> support an analogous nonattached `FontStretch` property, which the content host uses for rendering.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
A <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretch"></xref> structure that specifies the desired font-stretching characteristics to use.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.FontStretches.Normal"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStretch"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the font style for the content of the element.
This dependency property also has an attached property usage.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is \<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName>="*value*".../>, where *object* is an object element (typically a flow element) contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>, and *value* is one of the string-format property names in the <xref:System.Windows.FontStyles> class.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.GetFontStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.SetFontStyle%2A> methods.

The attached property usage is not common, because most elements that can be contained in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> support an analogous nonattached `FontStyle` property, which the content host uses for rendering.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
A member of the <xref href="System.Windows.FontStyles"></xref> class that specifies the desired font style.
The default is determined by the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontStyle"></xref> value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStyle"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the top-level font weight for the content of the element.
This dependency property also has an attached property usage.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is \<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontWeight%2A?displayProperty=fullName>="*value*".../>, where *object* is an object element (typically a flow element) contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>, and *value* is one of the string-format values of the <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> enumeration.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.GetFontWeight%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.SetFontWeight%2A> methods.

The attached property usage is not common, because most elements that can be contained in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> support an analogous nonattached `FontWeight` property, which the content host uses for rendering.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
A member of the <xref href="System.Windows.FontWeights"></xref> class that specifies the desired font weight.
The default value is determined by the <xref href="System.Windows.SystemFonts.MessageFontWeight"></xref> value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontWeight"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> to apply to the content of the element.
For a table of swatches that shows the available predefined brush colors, see <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brushes>.
This dependency property also has an attached property usage.

In [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], the usage is \<*object* <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Foreground%2A?displayProperty=fullName>="*value*".../>, where *object* is an object element (typically a flow element) contained within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement>, and *value* is a string that resolves to a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brush> implementation value.
In code, the attached property usage is supported by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.GetForeground%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.SetForeground%2A> methods.

The attached property usage is not common, because most elements that can be contained in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextElement> support an analogous nonattached `Foreground` property, which the content host uses for rendering.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`

<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.SubPropertiesDoNotAffectRender%2A>
The brush used to apply to the text contents.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brushes.Black"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Foreground"></xref> dependency property.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontFamily"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontFamily"></xref> property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontFamily"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
d is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize"></xref> property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
d is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStretch"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStretch"></xref> property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStretch"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
d is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStyle"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStyle"></xref> property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStyle"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
d is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontWeight"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontWeight"></xref> property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontWeight"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
d is `null`.
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Foreground"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to retrieve the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Foreground"></xref> property.
The current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Foreground"></xref> attached property on the specified dependency object.
d is `null`.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate the logical children of the element.
An enumerator for the logical children.
Handles notifications that one or more of the dependency properties that exist on the element have had their effective values changed.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement.OnPropertyChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Arguments associated with the property value change.

The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.Property"></xref> property specifies which property has changed, the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.OldValue"></xref> property specifies the previous property value, and the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.NewValue"></xref> property specifies the new property value.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontFamily"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontFamily"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
d is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontSize"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
d is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStretch"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStretch"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
d is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStyle"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontStyle"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
d is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontWeight"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.FontWeight"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
d is `null`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Foreground"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.
The dependency object for which to set the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.Foreground"></xref> property.
The new value to set the property to.
d is `null`.
Gets or sets a collection of text effects to apply to the content of the element.
By default, this property is set to `null` and has no <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextEffectCollection> associated with it.
Before adding any text effects, create a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextEffectCollection> and assign it to this property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`

A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextEffectCollection"></xref> containing one or more <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TextEffect"></xref> objects that define effects to apply to the content in this element.
The default is `null` (not an empty collection).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement.TextEffects"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the currently effective typography variations for the content of the element.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument.Typography%2A> property is applicable only to [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_opentype](~/includes/tlasharptla-opentype-md.md)] fonts.
A typography variant has no effect on fonts that do not support the variant.
For more information on this topic, see [Typography in WPF](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/typography-in-wpf.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Typography"></xref> object that specifies the currently effective typography variations.
For a list of default typography values, see <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Typography"></xref>.
Adds a child object.
The child object to add.
Adds the text content of a node to the object.
The text to add to the object.
